questions.question: Which of the following is a disadvantage of using the range as a measure of dispersion?
options: It is influenced by outliers.
It is based on all values in the data set.
It is not affected by extreme values.
It provides a good approximation of the dispersion of data.

questions.question: What does a lower value of the standard deviation for a data set indicate?
options: The values are spread over a relatively larger range around the mean.
The values are clustered far away from the mean.
The values are spread evenly across the distribution.
The values are spread over a relatively smaller range around the mean.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Chebyshev's Theorem?
options: To determine the exact percentage of data values within a specific number of standard deviations from the mean in a normal distribution.
To estimate the mean of a dataset.
To determine the minimum percentage of data values that lie within a specific number of standard deviations from the mean for any distribution.
To calculate the standard deviation of a dataset.

questions.question: What is the key difference between a population parameter and a sample statistic?
options: A population parameter is calculated for a sample data set, while a sample statistic is calculated for a population data set.
A population parameter describes the variability in the data, while a sample statistic describes the central tendency.
A population parameter is a summary measure calculated for a population data set, while a sample statistic is a summary measure calculated for a sample data set.
There is no difference between a population parameter and a sample statistic.

questions.question: Why is standard deviation considered the most used measure of dispersion?
options: It is easy to calculate.
It is not affected by outliers.
It tells how closely the values of a data set are clustered around the mean.
It always has a high value.

questions.question: What does the mean deviation measure?
options: The square root of the variance.
The average deviation from the average value of a given data collection.
The range of the data set.
The maximum deviation from the mean.

questions.question: What is the effect of extreme values (outliers) on the mean deviation?
options: It is greatly affected by extreme values.
It is not affected by extreme values at all.
It gets least affected by extreme values.
It is more affected by extreme values than the standard deviation.

questions.question: What is the relationship between variance and standard deviation?
options: Variance is the square root of the standard deviation.
Standard deviation is the square root of the variance.
Variance and standard deviation are the same.
Variance is always greater than the standard deviation.

questions.question: According to the empirical rule, approximately what percentage of observations lie within one standard deviation of the mean in a bell-shaped distribution?
What is the primary reason for studying dispersion in a set of data?
options: To calculate the mean of the data.
To compare the spread in two or more distributions.
To identify outliers in the data.
To determine the central tendency of the data.
